t: How Chinese Sellers are Manipulating Amazon in 2025
s: Find out how Chinese sellers are manipulating Amazon and the tactics they're using to manipulate the platform.

3 days ago - Amazon.com, Inc., doing business as Amazon (/ˈæməzɒn/ ⓘ, AM-ə-zon; UK also /ˈæməzən/, AM-ə-zən), is an American multinational technology company engaged in e-commerce, cloud computing, online advertising, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence.

t: All Your Favorite Brands, From BSTOEM to ZGGCD - The New York Times
s: February 11, 2020 - Brands like Pvendor, RIVMOUNT, FRETREE and MAJCF. Gloves emblazoned with names like Nertpow, SHSTFD, Joyoldelf, VBIGER and Bizzliz. Gloves with hundreds or even thousands of apparently positive reviews, available for very low prices, shipped quickly, for free, with Amazon Prime.

1 week ago - Amazon China (Chinese: 亚马逊中国), formerly known as Joyo.com (Chinese: 卓越网), is an online shopping website. Joyo.com was founded in early 2000 by the Chinese entrepreneur Lei Jun in Beijing, China. The company primarily sold books and other media goods, shipping to customers nationwide.

t: How Amazon's Wooing Of Chinese Sellers Is Killing Small American Businesses
s: March 17, 2017 - While Amazon makes a big public stance against counterfeiters, the reality is that brands continue being outcompeted by knock-offs of their own products in the marketplace -- which is putting many innovative American brands on the brink of going out of business.

t: Amazon Brand Registry | Sell on Amazon
s: Enroll your brand in Amazon Brand Registry to unlock tools designed to protect and build your brand, creating a better experience for your Amazon customers.

November 26, 2024 - Amazon offers multiple lines of privately labeled products. These are available on Amazon.com, Amazon Fresh, Prime Pantry, Prime Now, Amazon Go, and Whole Foods Market. Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: Here's How U.S. Amazon Sellers Can Compete With Chinese Sellers
s: Competition on Amazon is getting hotter—much of it coming from China. Here's what U.S. Amazon sellers should know to compete and how to prepare.

t: Amazon bans three more Chinese brands for soliciting fake reviews
s: June 21, 2021 - Three brands under Shenzhen-based Sunvalley were banned from Amazon’s online site after they allegedly offered gift cards to customers who wrote positive product reviews.

t: Pukemark, Sweatyrocks, Demonlick: Made-for-Amazon Brand Names Are Getting Ridiculously Surreal
s: October 14, 2020 - I was recently shopping for clothes on Amazon when I noticed bizarre brand names popping up—more bizarre than usual, I mean. It’s common to come across unfamiliar brands on Amazon, where sellers are constantly fashioning product lines and whole brands around what shoppers are searching for.

t: BASDEHEN Brand Kitchen Faucets Recalled Due to Dangerous Lead Exposure for Young Children; Sold on Amazon.com by Chenfeng Store | CPSC.gov
s: Consumers should immediately stop using these faucets and contact Chenfeng Store about disposal and a refund. Consumers will need to provide a photograph of disposal to receive the refund. Amazon is contacting all known purchasers directly.Until these faucets can be replaced, consumers should ...

t: Amazon says it’s permanently banned 600 Chinese brands for review fraud | The Verge
s: September 17, 2021 - Following the high-profile disappearances of Aukey, Mpow, RavPower, Choetech and more, Amazon now says it’s cracked down on 3,000 seller accounts across 600 Chinese brands over the past five months.
